bwwExcerpt: I loved “KPOP” when I saw it five years ago Off Broadway, but the “KPOP” on Broadway is not the same show as the one in 2017, even though it has the same title, the same book writer and songwriters (and many of the same songs), the same director and choreographer, even the same storylines. It’s still exciting, sometimes thrilling — but it’s a packaged entertainment rather than an adventure in theater.
showScoreExcerpt:
I loved “KPOP” when I saw it five years ago Off Broadway, but the “KPOP” on Broadway is not the same show …. It’s still exciting, sometimes thrilling -- but it's a packaged entertainment rather than an adventure in theater.… a K-pop concert…. The stories are presented awkwardly and mostly feel like filler between the musical productions.
